metadata.title: CVE-2018-17205 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Open vSwitch (OvS) 2.7.x through 2.7.6,affecting ofproto_rule_insert__ in ofproto/ofproto.c. During bundle commit,flows that are added in a bundle are applied to ofproto in order. If a flowcannot be added (e.g., the flow action is a go-to for a group id that doesnot exist), OvS tries to revert back all previous flows that weresuccessfully applied from the same bundle. This is possible since OvSmaintains list of old flows that were replaced by flows from the bundle.While reinserting old flows, OvS has an assertion failure due to a check onrule state != RULE_INITIALIZED. This would work for new flows, but for anold flow the rule state is RULE_REMOVED. The assertion failure causes anOvS crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17205` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openvswitch-common - 2.9.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
openvswitch-pki - 2.9.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
openvswitch-switch - 2.9.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
openvswitch-switch-dpdk - 2.9.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
openvswitch-test - 2.9.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
openvswitch-testcontroller - 2.9.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
openvswitch-vtep - 2.9.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
ovn-central - 2.9.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
ovn-common - 2.9.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
ovn-controller-vtep - 2.9.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.3

python3-openvswitch - 2.9.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openvswitch package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.2-0ubuntu0.18.04.3').
